column4: is this chat actually useful? or should i just keep doing a google search?
how is it crashing, what is current, what browser.
the more info, the more likely you get help
what version of flash, hwo did you install it?
also, again, what browsers? Chrome bundles it's own Flash player, for example.
interesting.
does it crash on *everything* or are you only trying a specific site?
uh... what "flash settings" ?
the browser locks up? or just the flash applet where the settings thingy loads into?
what arch are you on?
what iso did you download?
hm, I'm not sure... let me do a bit of looking at something real fast.
what PPA did you enable to install flash?
that was my bad, I forgot it's in the repos now.
I'm not really sure how to help you... you probably ought to try running it in a command line shell to see if you can see the crash message.
the only other suggestion I have is a PPA that might have a slightly newer version, but that may simply exacerbate the problem.
close all of your Firefox windows.
then open `gnome-terminal`. Type "firefox" and then go to the flash page. See if anything useful prints in the terminal
I assume it's a flash tar.gz?
I would recommend removing the flash you have installed and seeking out a PPA from "seven machines". It has a very up-to-date copy of flash 11.
based on what sagarchalise is telling me and a quick check of version numbers... you're best off with the flash you had installed before.
I don't know why it doesn't work, I'm very sorry.
